class.name: InputEventScreenDrag
class.description: Stores information about screen drag events. See [method Node._input].

members.member: The drag event index in the case of a multi-drag event.
Returns [code]true[/code] when using the eraser end of a stylus pen.
Represents the pressure the user puts on the pen. Ranges from [code]0.0[/code] to [code]1.0[/code].

The drag position relative to the previous position (position at the last frame). [b]Note:[/b] [member relative] is automatically scaled according to the content scale factor, which is defined by the project's stretch mode settings. This means touch sensitivity will appear different depending on resolution when using [member relative] in a script that handles touch aiming. To avoid this, use [member relative_unscaled] instead.

The drag position relative to the previous position (position at the last frame)., but not scaled according to the content scale factor or calls to [method InputEvent.xformed_by]. This should be preferred over [member relative] for touch aiming regardless of the project's stretch mode.

Represents the angles of tilt of the pen. Positive X-coordinate value indicates a tilt to the right. Positive Y-coordinate value indicates a tilt toward the user. Ranges from [code]-1.0[/code] to [code]1.0[/code] for both axes.

The drag velocity in pixels per second. [b]Note:[/b] [member velocity] is automatically scaled according to the content scale factor, which is defined by the project's stretch mode settings. This means touch sensitivity will appear different depending on resolution when using [member velocity] in a script that handles touch aiming. To avoid this, use [member velocity_unscaled] instead.

The drag velocity in pixels per second, but not scaled according to the content scale factor or calls to [method InputEvent.xformed_by]. This should be preferred over [member velocity] for touch aiming regardless of the project's stretch mode.
